body: I guess adding an optional utility class for this would be fairly harmless. It should be possible to register the exception, error and shutdown handlers separately though IMO.
I'm suprised this isn't already here, I would primarily use this to log errors/exceptions

@unstoppablecarl it's not in because I (and most people originally, not sure how that changed over time) use monolog within symfony which takes care of calling the logger when an exception occurs. I assume other frameworks do similar things, so this is really mainly useful for people using it standalone in a custom project. That is not to say it's not valuable though, I think it's a cool addition to have.

In my case I'm using zf2 and this is not built in unless using their logger
instead.

Well if you'd like to help feel free, reusing bits and pieces from the raven one you should be able to wrap something up without too much work.
As the Symfony Debug component is now standalone and supports logging to any PSR-3 logger, is it worth it to duplicate the logic in Monolog itself ?

@stof I'd like to say yes but as it stands the debug component isn't very nice to use standalone IMO - and it doesn't seems to log exceptions, it just logs fatals as CRITICAL and E_DEPRECATED as WARNING if you give it a logger, but it doesn't log the other E_\* levels, and logging isn't very customizable. Given that it's not much code I'd rather have something that works well with monolog in a standalone way.

there are some little libs out there, which support handling fatals with a few lines of code

e.g. https://github.com/Tyrael/php-error-handler
or a more suitable is https://github.com/sobstel/Execution

I'd rather something was implemented in monolog similar to the raven code, I don't see any reason for code this simple to be abstracted into a separate library. 

`...which support handling fatals with a few lines of code`

I think you hit the nail on the head there, it's only a few lines of code to implement so let's get it in Monolog.
OK master now has a Monolog\ErrorHandler class if anyone wants to give it a try.

How can I use the fatal error handler in a symfony2 application ? I couldn't find anything about `registerShutdownFunction` in the monolog bundle, and I would like to be able to send fatal error reports to sentry.
@greg0ire Symfony registers its own error handler for fatal errors (in which it calls the logger too)
